headline: KAL’s cartoon

children.data: Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Israel’s proposed legal reforms are a dreadful answer to a real problem
The overhaul of Israel’s judiciary will maim its democracy, says Polly Bronstein
Binyamin Netanyahu rushes to take on Israel’s Supreme Court
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s

bodyText:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Israel’s proposed legal reforms are a dreadful answer to a real problem (Feb 2023)
The overhaul of Israel’s judiciary will maim its democracy, says Polly Bronstein (Feb 2023)
Binyamin Netanyahu rushes to take on Israel’s Supreme Court (Jan 2023)
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.

parts.description: Investors are betting on good times. The likelier prospect is turbulence

parts.headline: Nicola Sturgeon’s resignation is part of Britain’s great moderation
parts.description: Pragmatism is taking hold north and south of the border

parts.headline: Israel’s proposed legal reforms are a dreadful answer to a real problem
parts.description: They will damage the country at home and abroad

parts.headline: The world won’t decarbonise fast enough unless renewables make real money
parts.description: Governments must accept that green power is pricey

parts.headline: Nigeria desperately needs a new kind of leadership
parts.description: Peter Obi offers the best hope of it

_metadata.articleBody:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Israel’s proposed legal reforms are a dreadful answer to a real problem (Feb 2023)
The overhaul of Israel’s judiciary will maim its democracy, says Polly Bronstein (Feb 2023)
Binyamin Netanyahu rushes to take on Israel’s Supreme Court (Jan 2023)
